<p><b><ab>cf.</ab>~<c><ab>Zd.</ab></c>~<etym>ka</etym>~,~<etym>ko7</etym>~,~<etym>kA7</etym>~,~<etym>kat</etym>~~;~~<c><ab>Gk.</ab>_<gk>1</gk>_,_<gk>2</gk>_,_<p1>Ion._<gk>3</gk>_,_<gk>4</gk>_,</p1> <c>The_interrogative_sentence_introduced_by</c> <s>ka</s> <c>is_often_terminated_by</c> <s>iti</s> <p><ab>e.g.</ab>~<s>kasya sa putra iti kaTyatAm</s>~,~<c>let_it_be_said_,_</c> <quote>_whose_son_is_he?_</quote></p> <c>_,_but</c> <s>iti</s> <c>may_be_omitted_and_the_sentence_lose_its_direct_interrogative_character</c> <p><ab>e.g.</ab>~<s>kasya sa putro na jYAyate</s>~,~<c>it_is_not_known_whose_son_he_is</c></p> <c>.</c> <s>ka</s> <c>with_or_without</c> <root/>1.~<s>as</s> <c>may_express_<quote>_how_is_it_possible_that?_</quote>_<quote>_what_power_have_I_,_you_,_they_,_<etc1/>?_</quote></c> <p><ab>e.g.</ab>~<s>ke mama Danvino'nye</s>~,~<c>what_can_the_other_archers_do_against_me?</c>~<s>ke AvAm paritrAtum</s>~,~<c>what_power_have_we_to_rescue_you?</c></p> <s>ka</s> <c>is_often_connected_with_a_demonstrative</c> <ab>pron.</ab> <p><ab>e.g.</ab>~<s>ko 'yam AyAti</s>~,~<c>who_comes_here?</c></p> <c>_or_with_the_potential</c> <p><ab>e.g.</ab>~<s>ko hariM nindet</s>~,~<c>who_will_blame_<as0>Hari</as0><as1><s>hari</s></as1>?</c></p> <s>ka</s> <c>is_sometimes_repeated</c> <p><ab>e.g.</ab>~<s>kaH ko 'tra</s>~,~<c>who_is_there?</c>~<s>kAn type="ns">Avata1rs</asp0><as1>Avatars</as1>_or_incarnations_<p><c>in_the_earlier_legends_he_appears_as_a_great_hero_and_teacher</c>~<b><ls>MBh.</ls>~<ls>Bhag.</ls></b>~;~<c>in_the_more_recent_he_is_deified_,_and_is_often_represented_as_a_young_and_amorous_shepherd_with_flowing_hair_and_a_flute_in_his_hand</c>~;~<c>the_following_are_a_few_particulars_of_his_birth_and_history_as_related_in</c>~<ls>Hariv._3304_ff.</ls>~<c>and_in_the_<asp0>Pura1n2as</asp0><as1><s>purARa</s>s</as1>_<etc1/>:_<as0>Vasu-deva</as0><as1><s>vasu-deva</s></as1>_,_who_was_a_descendant_of_<as0>Yadu</as0><as1><s>yadu</s></as1>_and_<as0>Yaya1ti</as0><as1><s>yayAti</s></as1>_,_had_two_wives_,_<as0>Rohin2i1</as0><as1><s>rohiRI</s></as1>_and_<as0>Devaki1</as0><as1><s>devakI</s></as1></c>~;~<c>the_latter_had_eight_sons_of_whom_the_eighth_was_<as0>Kr2ishn2a</as0><as1><s>kfzRa</s></as1></c>~;~<c><as0>Kan6sa</as0><as1><s>kaMsa</s></as1>_,_king_of_<as0>Mathura1</as0><as1><s>maTurA</s></as1>_and_cousin_of_<as0>Devaki1</as0><as1><s>devakI</s></as1>_,_was_informed_by_a_prediction_that_one_of_these_sons_would_kill_him</c>~;~<c>he_therefore_kept_<as0>Vasu-deva</as0><as1><s>vasu-deva</s></as1>_and_his_wife_in_confinement_,_and_slew_their_first_six_children</c>~;~<c>the_seventh_was_<as0>Balara1ma</as0><as1><s>balarAma</s></as1>_who_was_saved_by_being_abstracted_from_the_womb_of_<as0>Devaki1</as0><as1><s>devakI</s></as1>_and_transferred_to_that_of_<as0>Rohin2i1</as0><as1><s>rohiRI</s></as1></c>~;~<c>the_eighth_was_<as0>Kr2ishn2a</as0><as1><s>kfzRa</s></as1>_who_was_born_with_black_skin_and_a_peculiar_mark_on_his_breast</c>~;~<c>his_father_<as0>Vasu-deva</as0><as1><s>vasu-deva</s></as1>_managed_to_escape_from_<as0>Mathura1</as0><as1><s>maTurA</s></as1>_with_the_child_,_and_favoured_by_the_gods_found_a_herdsman_named_<as0>Nanda</as0><as1><s>nanda</s></as1>_whose_wife_<as0>Yas3o-da1</as0><as1><s>yaSo-dA</s></as1>_had_just_been_delivered_of_a_son_which_<as0>Vasu-deva</as0><as1><s>vasu-deva</s></as1>_conveyed_to_<as0>D type="ns">Hindu1</as0><as1>Hindu</as1>_religion_<p>these_works_were_primarily_three_,_viz._1._the_<as0>R2ig-veda</as0><as1><s>fg-veda</s></as1>_,_2._the_<as0>Yajur-veda</as0><as1><s>yajur-veda</s></as1>_<b><c1>of_which_there_are_,_however_,_two_divisions</c1>~<see/>~<s>tEttirIya-saMhitA</s>~,~<s>vAjasaneyi-saMhitA</s></b>~,~<c1>3._the_<as0>Sa1ma-veda</as0><as1><s>sAma-veda</s></as1></c1>~<pc>Page1015,2</pc>~;~<c1>these_three_works_are_sometimes_called_collectively</c1>~<s>trayI</s>~,~<c1><quote>_the_triple_<as0>Vidya1</as0><as1><s>vidyA</s></as1>_</quote>_or_<quote>_threefold_knowledge_</quote>_,_but_the_<as0>R2ig-veda</as0><as1><s>fg-veda</s></as1>_is_really_the_only_original_work_of_the_three_,_and_much_the_most_ancient_<b><c2>the_oldest_of_its_hymns_being_assigned_by_some_who_rely_on_certain_astronomical_calculations_to_a_period_between_4000_and_2500_B.C._,_before_the_settlement_of_the_<as0 type="ns">A1ryans</as0><as1>Aryans</as1>_in_India</c2>~;~<c2>and_by_others_who_adopt_a_different_reckoning_to_a_period_between_1400_and_1000_B.C._,_when_the_<as0 type="ns">A1ryans</as0><as1>Aryans</as1>_had_settled_down_in_the_<as0 type="ns">Panja1b</as0><as1>Panjab</as1></c2></b></c1>~;~<c1>subsequently_a_fourth_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_was_added_,_called_the_<as0>Atharva-veda</as0><as1><s>aTarva-veda</s></as1>_,_which_was_probably_not_completely_accepted_till_after_<as0>Manu</as0><as1><s>manu</s></as1>_,_as_his_law-book_often_speaks_of_the_three_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>-calling_them</c1>~<s>trayam brahma sanAtanam</s>~,~<c1><quote>_the_triple_eternal_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_</quote>_,_but_only_once_<b><ls>xi_,_33</ls></b>_mentions_the_revelation_made_to_<as0>Atharvan</as0><as1><s>aTarvan</s></as1>_and_<as0>An3giras</as0><as1><s>aNgiras</s></as1>_,_without_,_however_,_calling_it_by_the_later_name_of_<as0>Atharva-veda</as0><as1><s>aTarva-veda</s></as1></c1>~;~<c1>each_of_the_four_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>_has_two_distinct_parts_,_viz._1._<as0>Mantra</as0><as1><s>mantra</s></as1></c1>~,~ <ab>i.e.</ab>~<c1>words_of_prayer_and_adoration_often_addressed_either_to_fire_or_to_some_form_of_the_sun_or_to_some_form_of_the_air_,_sky_,_wind_<etc1/>_,_and_praying_for_health_,_wealth_,_long_life_,_cattle_,_offspring_,_victory_,_and_even_forgiveness_of_sins_,_and_2._<as0>Bra1hman2a</as0><as1><s>brAhmaRa</s></as1>_,_consisting_of_<as0>Vidhi</as0><as1><s>viDi</s></as1>_and_<as0>Artha-va1da</as0><as1><s>arTa-vAda</s></as1>_,_i.e._directions_for_the_detail_of_the_ceremonies_at_which_the_<asp0>Mantras</asp0><as1><s>mantra</s>s</as1>_were_to_be_used_and_explanations_of_the_legends_<etc1/>_connected_with_the_<asp0>Mantras</asp0><as1><s>mantra</s>s</as1>_</c1> <b><c1>see</c1>~<s>brAhmaRa</s>~,~<s>viDi</s></b>~,~<c1>both_these_portions_being_termed</c1>~<s>Sruti</s>~,~<c1>revelation_orally_communicated_by_the_Deity_,_and_heard_but_not_composed_or_written_down_by_men</c1>~<b><cf/>~<ls>IW._24_<etc1/></ls></b> <c1>_,_although_it_is_certain_that_both_<asp0>Mantras</asp0><as1><s>mantra</s>s</as1>_and_<asp0>Bra1hman2as</asp0><as1><s>brAhmaRa</s>s</as1>_were_compositions_spread_over_a_considerable_period_,_much_of_the_latter_being_comparatively_modern</c1>~;~<c1>as_the_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>_are_properly_three_,_so_the_<asp0>Mantras</asp0><as1><s>mantra</s>s</as1>_are_properly_of_three_forms_,_1._<as0>R2ic</as0><as1><s>fc</s></as1>_,_which_are_verses_of_praise_in_metre_,_and_intended_for_loud_recitation</c1>~;~<c1>2._<as0>Yajus</as0><as1><s>yajus</s></as1>_,_which_are_in_prose_,_and_intended_for_recitation_in_a_lower_tone_at_sacrifices</c1>~;~<c1>3._<as0>Sa1man</as0><as1><s>sAman</s></as1>_,_which_are_in_metre_,_and_intended_for_chanting_at_the_<as0>Soma</as0><as1><s>soma</s></as1>_or_Moon-plant_ceremonies_,_the_<asp0>Mantras</asp0><as1><s>mantra</s>s</as1>_of_the_fourth_or_<as0>Atharva-veda</as0><as1><s>aTarva-veda</s></as1>_having_no_special_name</c1>~;~<c1>but_it_must_be_borne_in_mind_that_the_<as0>Yajur</as0><as1><s>yajur</s></as1>_and_<as0>Sa1ma-veda</as0><as1><s>sAma-veda</s></as1>_hymns_,_especially_the_latter_,_besides_their_own_<asp0>Mantras</asp0><as1><s>mantra</s>s</as1>_,_borrow_largely_from_the_<as0>R2ig-veda</as0><as1><s>fg-veda</s></as1></c1>~;~<c1>the_<as0>Yajur-veda</as0><as1><s>yajur-veda</s></as1>_and_<as0>Sa1ma-veda</as0><as1><s>sAma-veda</s></as1>_being_in_fact_not_so_much_collections_of_prayers_and_hymns_as_special_prayer-_and_hymn-books_intended_as_manuals_for_the_<as0>Adhvaryu</as0><as1><s>aDvaryu</s></as1>_and_<as0>Udga1tr2i</as0><as1><s>udgAtf</s></as1>_priests_respectively_</c1> <b><c1>see</c1>~<s>yajur-veda</s>~,~<s>sAma-veda</s></b>~;~<c1>the_<as0>Atharva-veda</as0><as1><s>aTarva-veda</s></as1>_,_on_the_other_hand_,_is_,_like_the_<as0>R2ig-veda</as0><as1><s>fg-veda</s></as1>_,_a_real_collection_of_original_hymns_mixed_up_with_incantations_,_borrowing_little_from_the_<as0>R2ig</as0><as1><s>fg</s></as1>_and_having_no_direct_relation_to_sacrifices_,_but_supposed_by_mere_recitation_to_produce_long_life_,_to_cure_diseases_,_to_effect_the_ruin_of_enemies_<etc1/></c1>~;~<c1>each_of_the_four_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>_seems_to_have_passed_through_numerous_<asp0>S3a1kha1s</asp0><as1><s>SAKA</s>s</as1>_or_schools_,_giving_rise_to_various_recensions_of_the_text_,_though_the_<as0>R2ig-veda</as0><as1><s>fg-veda</s></as1>_is_only_preserved_in_the_<as0>S3a1kala</as0><as1><s>SAkala</s></as1>_recension_,_while_a_second_recension_,_that_of_the_<asp0>Bha1shkalas</asp0><as1><s>BAzkala</s>s</as1>_,_is_only_known_by_name</c1>~;~<c1>a_tradition_makes_<as0>Vya1sa</as0><as1><s>vyAsa</s></as1>_the_compiler_and_arranger_of_the_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>_in_their_present_form:_they_each_have_an_Index_or_<as0>Anukraman2i1</as0><as1><s>anukramaRI</s></as1>_<b><qv/></b>_,_the_principal_work_of_this_kind_being_the_general_Index_or_<as0>Sarva7nukraman2i1</as0><as1><s>sarvAnukramaRI</s></as1>_<b><qv/></b></c1>~;~<c1>out_of_the_<as0>Bra1hman2a</as0><as1><s>brAhmaRa</s></as1>_portion_of_the_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_grew_two_other_departments_of_Vedic_literature_,_sometimes_included_under_the_general_name_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_,_viz._the_strings_of_aphoristic_rules_,_called_<asp0>Su1tras</asp0><as1><s>sUtra</s>s</as1>_<b><qv/></b>_,_and_the_mystical_treatises_on_the_nature_of_God_and_the_relation_of_soul_and_matter_,_called_<as0>Upanishad</as0><as1><s>upanizad</s></as1>_<b><qv/></b>_,_which_were_appended_to_the_<asp0>A1ran2yakas</asp0><as1><s>AraRyaka</s>s</as1>_<b><qv/></b>_,_and_became_the_real_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_of_thinking_<as0 type="ns">Hindu1s</as0><as1>Hindus</as1>_,_leading_to_the_<asp0>Dars3anas</asp0><as1><s>darSana</s>s</as1>_or_systems_of_philosophy</c1>~;~<c1>in_the_later_literature_the_name_of_<quote>_fifth_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_</quote>_is_accorded_to_the_<asp0>Itiha1sas</asp0><as1><s>itihAsa</s>s</as1>_or_legendary_epic_poems_and_to_the_<asp0>Pura1n2as</asp0><as1><s>purARa</s>s</as1>_,_and_certain_secondary_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>_or_<asp0>Upa-vedas</asp0><as1><s>upa-veda</s>s</as1>_<b><qv/></b>_are_enumerated</c1>~;~<c1>the_<asp0>Veda7n3gas</asp0><as1><s>vedA<srs/>Nga</s>s</as1>_or_works_serving_as_limbs_<b>for_preserving_the_integrity</b>_of_the_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_are_explained_under</c1>~<s>vedA<srs/>Nga</s>~<c1>below:_the_only_other_works_included_under_the_head_of_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_being_the_<asp0>Paris3isht2as</asp0><as1><s>pariSizwa</s>s</as1>_,_which_supply_rules_for_the_ritual_omitted_in_the_<asp0>Su1tras</asp0><as1><s>sUtra</s>s</as1></c1>~;~<c1>in_the_<as0>Br2ihad-a1ran2yaka</as0><as1><s>bfhad-AraRyaka</s></as1>_<as0>Upanishad</as0><as1><s>upanizad</s></as1>_the_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>_are_represented_as_the_breathings_of_<as0>Brahma1</as0><as1><s>brahmA</s></as1>_,_while_in_some_of_the_<asp0>Pura1n2as</asp0><as1><s>purARa</s>s</as1>_the_four_<asp0>Vedas</asp0><as1><s>veda</s>s</as1>_are_said_to_have_issued_out_of_the_four_mouths_of_the_four-faced_<as0>Brahma1</as0><as1><s>brahmA</s></as1>_and_in_the_<as0>Vishn2u-Pura1n2a</as0><as1><s>vizRu-purARa</s></as1>_the_<as0>Veda</as0><as1><s>veda</s></as1>_and_<as0>Vishn2u</as0><as1><s>vizRu</s></as1>_are_identified</c1></p></c>
